name: Luck or Fate? Trivia Game | Death Becomes Them | 10 Questions

questions.text: Elizabeth Taylor's husband, Mike Todd, was killed in a plane crash. Liz was supposed to be on board, but didn't make the flight? Why?
questions.explanation:
Illness.

	She was running a high fever, so she couldn't make the trip. But for that...

questions.text: Buddy Holly died in a plane crash, as did the 'Big Bopper.' Who gave up his seat on the doomed plane to J.P. Richardson (the Bopper)?
questions.explanation:
Waylon Jennings.

	Jennings made a joke: 'I hope your plane crashes.' Unfortunate choice of words. Vee filled in for Holly after the crash. Peterson was the pilot.

questions.text: Buddy Holly also died in a plane crash, as did the 'Big Bopper.' How did Richie Valens 'win' his seat on the plane?
questions.explanation:
Flipped a coin.

	It was a flip of a coin. The 'winner' got the plane.

questions.text: John Wilkes Booth's conspiracy wasn't only against Lincoln: other political figures were also targets. Which individual was an intended target, but was spared any attack on his person?
questions.explanation:
Andrew Johnson.

	Seward was knifed repeatedly, but managed to survive. The intended attacker of Johnson, however, got drunk, lost his nerve, or both.

questions.text: Gordon Lightfoot immortalized the shipwreck of the Edmund Fitzgerald. Where did the ship go down?
questions.explanation:
Great Lakes region.

	It was about 16 or 17 miles from Whitefish point when it went under--probably only a few minutes travel time.

questions.text: Which notorious killer was caught partly as a result of a parking ticket?
questions.explanation:
David Berkowitz.

	'Son of Sam' was tracked down as a result of a parking ticket that he received at the scene of a shooting. Would a dime in the meter have kept him at large a while longer?

questions.text: Jayne Mansfield was killed in a car crash on her way to a dinner club engagement. For whom was she substituting?
questions.explanation:
Mamie Van Doren.

	Van Doren had to bow out; Mansfield filled in. If not for that ...

questions.text: Christa McAuliffe was tragically killed when 'Challenger' exploded. Who was the alternate that would have been on board if McAuliffe had been unable to go?
questions.explanation:
Barbara Morgan.

	As close as a close call can possibly be.

questions.text: Ennis Cosby was killed within 15 miles of downtown L.A. What was he doing at the time?
questions.explanation:
Changing a tire.

	Ennis Cosby, the son of Bill Cosby, was murdered in 1997.

questions.text: The C.E.O. of this company did not perish along with countless employees of his company on September 11 because he stopped off at his daughter's school.
questions.explanation:
Cantor Fitzgerald.

	What kind of 'survivor guilt' do you have when hundreds of your co-workers are gone?
